data.name: ActionCenterPanel.EmptyText
data.value: Nothing to take action on right now. You're all caught up!

data.name: AdministrationPanel.SecurityEventAutomationsExtraMessage
data.value:
Security Event Automations allow you to alert people and external systems to events regarding Login, Logout, Change Password and Reset Password attempts. The Event Filter syntax is very similar to the SQL "where" clause syntax. Properties, operators, literals, variables, and functions can be combined to create powerful expressions. The same properties can be used inside your actions to display information to users or provide information to external systems.

Login Attempt Results (Event.EventType = 'LoginAttempt')

SuccessThe user has successfully logged in
UserNameInvalidThe user has entered an unknown user name
PasswordInvalidThe user has entered an incorrect password
OneTimePasswordRequiredThe user has successfully entered a user name and password and must enter a one-time password
OneTimePasswordInvalidThe user has entered an invalid one-time password
OneTimePasswordProviderInvalidThe one-time password configuration for the user is misconfigured
OneTimePasswordUserKeyInvalidThe one-time password configuration for the user is misconfigured
LockedOutThe user has attempted to log in while the account was locked out
ChangeablePasswordExpiredThe user's password has expired and they need to change it
UnchangeablePasswordExpiredThe user's password has expired and they need to change it in the external user source

Reset Password Attempt Results (Event.EventType = 'ResetPasswordAttempt')

SuccessThe user has successfully reset their password
UserNameInvalidThe user has entered an unknown user name
ResetCodeInvalidThe user has attempted to reset their password, but provided an invalid reset code
NewPasswordInvalidThe password entered during the reset attempt did not meet the configured password requirements
NewPasswordMatchInvalidThe passwords entered during the reset attempt did not match
ResetPasswordFailureAn unexpected error occurred during the reset attempt
LockedOutThe user has attempted a password reset while the account was locked out
NotSupportedThe user source does not support resetting passwords from within ScreenConnect

Change Password Attempt Results (Event.EventType = 'ChangePasswordAttempt')

SuccessThe user has successfully changed their password
UserNameInvalidThe user has entered an unknown user name
CurrentPasswordInvalidThe current password entered during the password change attempt was incorrect
NewPasswordInvalidThe new password entered during the password change attempt did not meet the configured password requirements
NewPasswordMatchInvalidThe new passwords entered during the password change attempt did not match
LockedOutThe user has attempted a password change while the account was locked out
NotSupportedThe user source does not support changing passwords from within ScreenConnect

Logout Attempt Results (Event.EventType = 'LogoutAttempt')

SuccessThe user has successfully logged out
NotAuthenticatedThe user attempted to log out, but was not authenticated to begin with

Filter operators

ANDCombines two expressions and matches if they are both true
ORCombines two expressions and matches if one or both is true
NOTNegates an expression or operator
=Determines whether two values are equal
<>Determines whether two values are not equal
INUsed to see if a property is in a set of values
LIKEUsed to compare strings, usually with wildcards (* and % are both valid)

Filter literals

StringsQuoted with single quote character ('); escape single quotes inside the string with two consecutive single quotes
NumbersAll numbers can be used without quoting or any other special notation
Dates/TimesQuoted with single quote character (') or number sign (#)

Emitting data in actions

Output is formatted with {DataSpecifier:FormatSpecifier} curly brace notation. This can be used in most action fields to customize behavior.

Data specifiers:

  • Specifying '*' will select all objects with their properties in a hierarchy.
  • Specifying 'Session' will select the session object with it's properties.
  • Specifying 'Connection' will select the connection object with it's properties.
  • Specifying 'Event' will select the event object with it's properties.
  • Specifying, as an example, 'Session.Name' will just select the value of the session name property.

Format specifiers:

  • Specifying 'json' (or 'j' for short) will emit the selected data in JSON format.
  • Specifying 'jsnq' (or 'q' for short) will emit the selected data in JSON format, but without surrounding double quotes for strings, allowing the string to be used inside an outer JSON string.
  • Specifying 'xml' (or 'x' for short) will emit the selected data in XML format.
  • Specifying 'url' (or 'u' for short) will emit the selected data in URL format.
  • Specifying 'plain' (or 'p' for short) will emit the selected data in Plain format.
  • Omitting the format specifier will use the Plain format.

Examples:

  • {*:j} will emit all of the objects in a JSON hierarchy
  • {*:x} will emit all of the objects in a XML hierarchy
  • {Session.Name} will emit the session name
  • {Session:u} will emit all of the session properties in a URL-encoded string
  • {Session:u}&{Event:u} will emit all of the session and event properties in a URL-encoded string

Other usage notes

  • Parentheses can be used in filters for readability and to enforce operator precedence
  • Wildcards (* and %) can only be used in filters at the beginning or end of a LIKE expression, but not in the middle
  • No properties will ever be NULL, but rather empty strings

data.name: AdministrationPanel.SessionEventAutomationsExtraMessage
data.value:
Session Event Automations allow you to alert people and external systems to events that occur inside this system. The Event Filter syntax is very similar to the SQL "where" clause syntax. Properties, operators, literals, variables, and functions can be combined to create powerful expressions. The same properties can be used inside your actions to display information to users or provide information to external systems.

Available objects/properties

OldSession.*Session properties prior to any alterations made by the automation event (available properties are the same as those of Session listed below)
Session.SessionIDThe unique ID of the session in GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) format
Session.NameThe name of the session
Session.HostThe user name of the host of the session
Session.SessionTypeThe type of the session: 'Support', 'Meeting', or 'Access'
Session.IsPublicA flag indicating whether the session is public
Session.CodeThe access code for the session, if defined
Session.NotesA semicolon-delimited list of all notes added to the session
Session.HostConnectedCountThe number of hosts connected to the session
Session.GuestConnectedCountThe number of guests connected to the session
Session.CustomPropertyNThe value of custom property N; N is 1-8 (CustomProperty1 is "Company" OOTB)
Session.GuestLoggedOnUserDomainThe domain of the user logged onto the guest machine
Session.GuestLoggedOnUserNameThe name of the user logged onto the guest machine
Session.GuestLastActivityTimeThe time of last activity on the guest machine
Session.GuestMachineDomainThe domain or workgroup of the guest machine
Session.GuestMachineNameThe name of the guest machine
Session.GuestOperatingSystemNameThe name of the operating system of the guest machine
Session.GuestOperatingSystemVersionThe version of the guest operating system, in N.N.N.N notation
Session.GuestProcessorNameThe name of the processor on the guest machine
Session.GuestProcessorVirtualCountThe number of virtual processors on the guest machine
Session.GuestSystemMemoryTotalMegabytesThe total system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes
Session.GuestSystemMemoryAvailableMegabytesThe available system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes
Session.GuestClientVersionThe version of client software on the guest machine, in N.N.N.N notation
Session.GuestNetworkAddressThe network address of the guest machine, usually in N.N.N.N IPv4 notation (set during connection events)
Connection.ConnectionIDThe unique ID of the connection in GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) format
Connection.ProcessTypeThe process type ('Unknown', 'Guest', 'Host') of the connection as a string
Connection.ClientTypeThe client type ('Unknown', 'DotNetWinForms', 'JavaSwing', 'JavaAndroid', 'MonoTouchIos') of the connection as a string
Connection.ClientVersionThe client version of the connection
Connection.AttributesThe attributes of the connection, currently unused
Connection.NetworkAddressThe network address of the connection, usually in N.N.N.N IPv4 notation
Connection.ParticipantNameThe participant name of the connection
Connection.ConnectedTimeThe date/time connected of the connection
Event.EventIDThe unique ID of the event in GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) format
Event.HostThe host that performed the event, if it was performed outside of a connection
Event.EventTypeThe type of the event as a string; values are listed below
Event.TimeThe date/time of the event
Event.DataData that describes the event

Event types

  • DeletedEvent, ProcessedEvent, AcknowledgedEvent, AnnotatedEvent
  • Connected, Disconnected
  • CreatedSession, DeletedSession
  • InitiatedJoin, InvitedGuest, AddedNote
  • QueuedReinstall, QueuedUninstall, QueuedInvalidateLicense, QueuedWake, QueuedCommand, QueuedMessage, QueuedGuestInfoUpdate, QueuedTool, QueuedElevatedTool, QueuedForceDisconnect, QueuedInstallAccess, QueuedUninstallAndDelete, QueuedProceedElevation, QueuedProceedAdministrativeLogon
  • EncounteredElevationPrompt, EncounteredLogonScreen, RequestedElevation, RequestedAdministrativeLogon, ApprovedRequest, DeniedRequest, CanceledRequest
  • ModifiedName, ModifiedIsPublic, ModifiedCode, ModifiedHost, ModifiedCustomProperty, ModifiedGuestInfo*
  • RanCommand, SentMessage
  • SentPrintJob, ReceivedPrintJob, CopiedText, CopiedFiles, DraggedFiles, RanFiles, SentFiles, SwitchedLogonSession, RanAutoReinstall, ResetRegisteredGuestClient

(* ModifiedGuestInfo is not stored in the database and is only available to automations)

Filter operators

ANDCombines two expressions and matches if they are both true
ORCombines two expressions and matches if one or both is true
NOTNegates an expression or operator
=Determines whether two values are equal
<>Determines whether two values are not equal
<Determines whether one value is less than another value
>Determines whether one value is greater than another value
<=Determines whether one value is less than or equal to another value
>=Determines whether one value is greater than or equal to another value
INUsed to see if a property is in a set of values
LIKEUsed to compare strings, usually with wildcards (* and % are both valid)
+Add two values together
-Subtract one value from another
*Multiply two values together
/Divide one value by another
%Mod one value by another

Filter functions

LEN(expression)Return the length of a string
IIF(expression, trueResult, falseResult)Return one of two values depending on whether the expression is true or false
ISNULL(expression, resultIfNull)Return the value of the expression or another value if the expression returns null
TRIM(expression)Trim whitespace from the beginning and end of a string
SUBSTRING(expression, start, length)Get part of a string
CONVERT(expression, type)Explicitly convert between datatypes

Filter literals

StringsQuoted with single quote character ('); escape single quotes inside the string with two consecutive single quotes
NumbersAll numbers can be used without quoting or any other special notation
Dates/TimesQuoted with single quote character (') or number sign (#)

Emitting data in actions

Output is formatted with {DataSpecifier:FormatSpecifier} curly brace notation. This can be used in most action fields to customize behavior.

Data specifiers:

  • Specifying '*' will select all objects with their properties in a hierarchy.
  • Specifying 'Session' will select the session object with it's properties.
  • Specifying 'Connection' will select the connection object with it's properties.
  • Specifying 'Event' will select the event object with it's properties.
  • Specifying, as an example, 'Session.Name' will just select the value of the session name property.

Format specifiers:

  • Specifying 'json' (or 'j' for short) will emit the selected data in JSON format.
  • Specifying 'jsnq' (or 'q' for short) will emit the selected data in JSON format, but without surrounding double quotes for strings, allowing the data to be concatenated inside an outer JSON string.
  • Specifying 'xml' (or 'x' for short) will emit the selected data in XML format.
  • Specifying 'url' (or 'u' for short) will emit the selected data in URL format.
  • Specifying 'plain' (or 'p' for short) will emit the selected data in Plain format.
  • Omitting the format specifier will use the Plain format.

Examples:

  • {*:j} will emit all of the objects in a JSON hierarchy
  • {*:x} will emit all of the objects in a XML hierarchy
  • {Session.Name} will emit the session name
  • {Session:u} will emit all of the session properties in a URL-encoded string
  • {Session:u}&{Event:u} will emit all of the session and event properties in a URL-encoded string

Other usage notes

  • Parentheses can be used in filters for readability and to enforce operator precedence
  • Wildcards (* and %) can only be used in filters at the beginning or end of a LIKE expression, but not in the middle
  • No properties will ever be NULL, but rather empty strings

data.name: AppearancePanel.ResourcesTable.EmptyMessage
data.value: Please make sure the spelling is correct or try a different filter.

data.name: AuditPanel.BasicLevelDescription
data.value: Track basic session events such as connects, disconnects, reinstalls, uninstalls, transfers, and notes. Data such as host name and IP address is included. Consumes little disk space.

data.name: AuditPanel.ExtendedLevelDescription
data.value: Audit everything in Basic Auditing. In addition, stores all captured screen activity from every session. Captures are downloadable as video files. WARNING: Consumes significant disk space.

data.name: AutomationPanel.AutomationsTable.EmptyMessage
data.value: Please make sure the spelling is correct or try a different filter.

data.name: BuildInstallerPanel.EmailSubjectFormat
data.value: {0} has sent you a ScreenConnect agent installer

data.name: BuildInstallerPanel.HtmlEmailBodyFormat
data.value:
Run the ScreenConnect agent installer to get connected.

To download the installer, click the button below.

Download Now

Or use this link:

{1:url}

 

Need help installing the agent? Click Here

This session is powered by ScreenConnect TM.

data.name: BuildInstallerPanel.Paragraph1Message
data.value: Build an installer to deploy to remote machines and permanently install the access agent. After installation, the agent will appear in the Access section.

data.name: BuildInstallerPanel.Paragraph2Message
data.value: Label your machines using the following fields, and pick your installer type:

data.name: BuildInstallerPanel.ShareMessage
data.value: Select an option to share your installer:

data.name: BuildInstallerPanel.TextEmailBodyFormat
data.value: Go to the web address below to download installer: <{1:url}>

data.value: Invalid current password. Please try again.

data.name: ChangePasswordPanel.LockedOutErrorMessage

data.name: ChangePasswordPanel.NewPasswordInvalidErrorMessage

data.name: Command.AccessManagement.Message
data.value: Encountered Elevation Prompts will display here. To receive Elevation and Administrative Logon Requests, adjust your ScreenConnect Privileged Access settings or upgrade your license.

data.name: Command.AddLicense.Message
data.value: Add your license by pasting into the box below:

data.name: Command.AddNote.Message
data.value: Add notes to log work or provide identification for sessions.

data.name: Command.CopyToClipboard.FailureMessage
data.value: Browser doesn't support this feature. Please copy text manually.

data.name: Command.CreateSecurityEventAutomation.Description
data.value: Create a security event automation to receive notifications about login attempts, logout attempts, reset password attempts, and change password attempts.

data.name: Command.CreateSessionEventAutomation.Description
data.value: Create a session event automation to receive notifications about session connections, Access Management requests, or actions that happen during a remote session.

data.name: Command.Delete.Message
data.value: Delete will remove the sessions from this view. You and your guests will be disconnected from the session and will be unable to join in the future.

data.name: Command.Reinstall.Message
data.value: Reinstall will attempt to upgrade the software of the remote machine to the current version. It will be processed at the time the machine is connected without a host connected.

data.name: Command.RemoveLicense.Message
data.value: Are you sure you want to remove this license? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: Command.RunCommand.Message
data.value: Run commands on the remote systems. Results from the commands are viewable on each session.

data.name: Command.RunTool.Message
data.value: Run a tool on the remote system. The tool will be run when the machine is connected.

data.name: Command.SendMessage.Message
data.value: Send messages to the remote systems. The messages will appear to the user in the client software.

data.name: Command.Toolbox.EmptyMessage
data.value: Your shared toolbox is empty. Drag a file into this window or use Upload File to upload it to the toolbox.

data.name: Command.Transfer.Message
data.value: Transfer sessions to a different host:

data.name: Command.Uninstall.Message
data.value: Uninstall will attempt to remove the client software from the remote machine. It will be processed at the time the machine is connected without a host connected.

data.name: Command.UninstallExtension.Message
data.value: Uninstall will delete the extension from your installation. Continue?

data.name: Command.Wake.Message
data.value: Wake will trigger Wake-on-LAN signals from other machines on the same network. Make sure you have already installed an agent within this machine’s network, and make sure this machine has Wake-on-LAN configured.

data.name: DeleteActionPanel.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this Action? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: DeleteAutomationPanel.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this Automation? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: DeleteRolePanel.Text

data.name: DeleteSessionGroupPanel.DeleteSessionGroupFormat
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete session group "{0}"? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: DeleteToolboxItemPanel.MessageFormat
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete "{0}"?

data.name: DeleteUninstallSessionPanel.DeleteDescription
data.value: Kill the session and permanently disconnect the agent from your Host page. You will not be able to connect to this session again without reinstalling the agent.

data.name: DeleteUninstallSessionPanel.Description
data.value: How would you like to remove this session?

data.name: DeleteUninstallSessionPanel.UninstallAndDeleteDescription
data.value: Kill the session and request permanent disconnection and uninstallation of the agent from the remote machine. The request will be processed when the machine is connected without a host.

data.name: DeleteUninstallSessionPanel.UninstallDescription
data.value: Request permanent uninstallation of the agent from the remote machine; the agent will remain inactive on your Host page. The request will be processed when the machine is connected without a host.

data.name: DeleteUninstallSessionPanel.WarningMessage
data.value: This action cannot be undone! Click CONFIRM to continue.

data.name: DeleteUserPanel.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete user '{0}'? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: DisableUserSourcePanel.Text
data.value: Are you sure you want to disable this user source?

data.name: EditRolePanel.HasDifferentPermissionsWarningText
data.value: Your selected scopes have different permission sets. To continue, please click 'Select All' or 'Unselect All' to make the permission sets the same, or select other scopes.

data.name: EditRolePanel.HasDifferentSessionTypesWarningLabelText
data.value: Please select session groups that are under the same session type.

data.name: EditRolePanel.HasSpecificGroupConflictsWarningLabelText
data.value: Please make sure that your selected session groups do not have a parent/child relationship with each other.

data.name: EditRolePanel.Instructions
data.value:
There are several permission types available for administrators to select when defining their roles:

Global Permissions

AdministerProvides access to the administration page of the software.
ManageSessionGroupsProvides access to the session groups link on the Host Page.
CreateSupportSessionPermits the Host to create a session (Listed, Code, or Email).
CreateMeetingSessionPermits the Host to create a new meeting (online presentation).
BuildAccessInstallerProvides access to the building an unattended access client button on the Host Page.
ManageSharedToolboxDetermines whether a user can access properties of the shared toolbox, like adding, deleting, and renaming files or folders.

Scoped Permissions

ViewSessionGroupDesignates whether a user can see All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
ViewSessionGuestScreenshotAllows a host to view screen preview thumbnails from technicians. Available in 6.1 .
JoinSessionProvides permission to join specific sessions including: All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
DeleteSessionAllows a user to delete sessions in:All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
TransferSessionProvides permission to transfer sessions from one user to another in: All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
EditSessionThe host can edit the existing details of a session, such as session name and session type. This permission can apply to All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
RunCommandOutsideSessionAllows a host to use the "Commands" tab on the Host page to run terminal-like commands on a remote machine. This permission can apply to All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
AddNoteToSessionProvides permission to add note to sessions in: All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
RemoveNoteFromSessionDesignates whether users can remove notes from specific sessions including: All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
RemoveCommandFromSessionA host with this permission can delete output from the Commands section of the Host page. This permission can apply to All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
ReinstallSessionPermits the user to reinstall an unattended session, with the choice of either upgrading the installer or upgrading the installer and renaming the unattended session. The options for groups include: All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
UninstallSessionDetermines whether the user can uninstall an unattended session from specific groups including: All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups.
TransferFilesA host with this permission can transfer files to and from a remote machine.
PrintInSessionAllows a host to use remote printing within a session. This permission can apply to All Session Groups, Support Session Groups, Access Session Groups, or Specific Session Groups. Available in version 5.6 .
RunSharedToolAsUserAllows a host to run a tool from the shared toolbox.
RunSharedToolAsSystemSilentlyAllows a host to run a shared tool as system user without end user interaction.
RunPersonalToolAsUserAllows a host to run a tool from the personal toolbox.
RunPersonalToolAsSystemSilentlyAllows a host to run a personal tool as system user without end user interaction.
HostSessionWithoutConsentDetermines whether the "click-to-consent" dialog box will appear on the guest's side.
CreateHostPassA host with this permission can create and share Host Passes.

data.name: EditRolePanel.RoleNameReadOnlyMessage
data.value: Role Name cannot be changed after initially creating the role

data.name: EditSchedulePanel.TimeFormatErrorMessage
data.value: Please enter server time as HH:MM

data.name: EditSecurityEventAutomationPanel.EventFilterSyntaxItems
data.value: Event.EventType = 'LoginAttempt' AND Event.OperationResult = 'Success' Successful Login Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'LoginAttempt' AND Event.OperationResult = 'UserNameInvalid' Invalid User Name Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'LoginAttempt' AND Event.OperationResult = 'LockedOut' Account Locked Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'ChangePasswordAttempt' AND Event.OperationResult = 'Success' Password Changed Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'ResetPasswordAttempt' AND Event.OperationResult = 'Success' Password Reset Popular Expressions

data.name: EditSessionEventAutomationPanel.EventFilterSyntaxItems
data.value: Connection.ProcessType = 'Guest' Guest Connection Popular Expressions Session.SessionType = 'Access' Access Session Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'Disconnected' AND Connection.ProcessType = 'Host' Host Disconnected Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'Disconnected' AND Connection.ProcessType = 'Guest' Guest Disconnected Popular Expressions Session.HostConnectedCount = 0 No Hosts Connected Popular Expressions Connection.ProcessType = 'Host' Host Connection Popular Expressions Session.SessionType = 'Support' Support Session Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'SentMessage' Sent Message Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'CreatedSession' Created Session Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'DeletedSession' AND Connection.ProcessType = 'Host' Host Deleted Session Popular Expressions Session.GuestOperatingSystemsName Like "Server" Machine with Server OS Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'Connected' Connected Popular Expressions Event.EventType = 'RanCommand' Ran Command Popular Expressions Session.HostConnectedCount = 1 1 Host Connected Popular Expressions Event.EventType = InitiatedJoin Guest Initiated Join Popular Expressions Session.HostConnectedCount > 1 More than 1 Host Connected Popular Expressions

data.name: EditSessionGroupPanel.Instructions
data.value:
Usage notes

The Session Filter syntax is similar to the SQL "where" clause syntax. Properties, operators, literals, variables, and functions can be combined to create powerful expressions.

The Subgroup Expression syntax is similar to the list of columns in a SQL "select" list. The same powerful expressions are available as in the Session Filters. Multiple expressions can be separated with a comma to create multiple levels of nesting.

  • Parentheses can be used for readability and to enforce operator precedence
  • Wildcards (* and %) can only be used at the beginning or end of a LIKE expression, but not in the middle
  • No properties will ever be NULL, but rather empty strings

Examples

CustomProperty1 = 'CompanyA' Sessions where company is "CompanyA" (CustomProperty1 is "Company" by default)
Name LIKE 'SERVER-*' Sessions where the name starts with "SERVER-"
Host = $USERNAME Sessions where the host is the current user
Notes LIKE '*server*' Sessions where the notes contain the word "server"
(Name LIKE 'CompanyA%') AND (Notes LIKE '*server*') Sessions where the name starts with "CompanyA" and the notes contain the word "server"
$OTHEROR Sessions that are in another session group
NOT $OTHEROR Sessions that are not in another session group
GuestConnectedCount = 0 AND LastConnectedEventTime < $7DAYSAGO Sessions where no guest is connected and no one has connected for 7 days
HostConnectedCount > 0 AND GuestConnectedCount > 0 Sessions where both a host and a guest are connected
HostConnectedCount = 0 AND GuestConnectedCount > 0 Sessions where just a guest is connected
HostConnectedCount > GuestConnectedCount Sessions where more hosts are connected than guests
IsPublic = 1 Sessions that are public
LEN(Code) > 0 Sessions that have a code
IsPublic = 0 AND LEN(Code) = 0 Sessions that aren't public and don't have a code
Notes LIKE '*' + $USERNAME + '*' Sessions that contain the current user name in the notes
Host IN ('Bill', 'Bob', 'Sarah') Sessions where host is either Bill, Bob, or Sarah
SUBSTRING(Name, 5, 4) = 'TEST' Sessions where characters 5-9 of the name are "TEST" (work-around for no wildcards in the middle)

Properties

SessionID The unique ID of the session in GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) format
SessionType The type of the session where 0 = Support, 1 = Meeting, and 2 = Access
Name The name of the session
Host The user name of the host of the session
IsPublic A flag indicating whether the session is public
Code The access code for the session, if defined
Notes A semicolon-delimited list of all notes added to the session
FirstEventTime The time of the first event of a session
LastEventTime The time of the most recent event added to the session
LastConnectedEventTime The time of the most recent connection for the session
LastHostConnectedEventTime The time of the most recent host connection for the session
LastGuestConnectedEventTime The time of the most recent guest connection for the session
LastDisconnectedEventTime The time of the most recent disconnection for the session
LastGuestDisconnectedEventTime The time of the most recent guest disconnection for the session
HostConnectedCount The number of hosts connected to the session
GuestConnectedCount The number of guests connected to the session
ConnectedParticipantNames A comma-delimited list of all named participants connected to the session
LogonSessionDisplayNames A comma-delimited list of display names in the current logon session
CustomPropertyN The value of custom property N; N is 1-8 (CustomProperty1 is "Company" OOTB)
GuestIsLocalAdminPresent A flag indicating whether a local administrator is present on the guest machine
GuestLoggedOnUserDomain The domain of the user logged onto the guest machine
GuestLoggedOnUserName The name of the user logged onto the guest machine
GuestLastActivityTime The time of last activity on the guest machine
GuestMachineDomain The domain or workgroup of the guest machine
GuestMachineName The name of the guest machine
GuestOperatingSystemName The name of the operating system of the guest machine
GuestOperatingSystemVersion The version of the guest operating system, in N.N.N.N notation
GuestOperatingSystemInstallationTime The time when the operating system was installed upon a guest machine
GuestProcessorName The name of the processor on the guest machine
GuestProcessorVirtualCount The number of virtual processors on the guest machine
GuestSystemMemoryTotalMegabytes The total system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes
GuestSystemMemoryAvailableMegabytes The available system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes
GuestAttributes A flag indicating whether guest credentials are stored
GuestScreenshotContentType The content type of the preview image shown for the guest machine ('jpeg', 'png', etc.)
GuestOperatingSystemManufacturerName The manufacturer of the guest operating system
GuestMachineManufacturerName The manufacturer of the guest machine
GuestMachineModel The model of the guest machine
GuestMachineProductNumber The product number of the guest machine
GuestMachineSerialNumber The serial number of the guest machine
GuestMachineDescription The description of the guest machine
GuestProcessorArchitecture The processor architecture on the guest machine ('X64', 'X86', 'Arm32', 'Arm64', 'Unknown')
GuestClientVersion The version of client software on the guest machine, in N.N.N.N notation
GuestNetworkAddress The network address of the guest machine, usually in N.N.N.N IPv4 notation
GuestPrivateNetworkAddress The private network address of the guest machine
GuestHardwareNetworkAddress The hardware network address of the guest machine
GuestTimezoneName The timezone of the guest machine
GuestTimezoneOffsetHours An integer indicating the number of hours offset from UTC time of the guest machine
GuestLastBootTime The last boot time of the guest machine
GuestInfoUpdateTime The last time guest info was updated
QueuedEventCount The number of currently queued session events
UnacknowledgedEventCount The number of currently unacknowledged session events
PendingRequestEventCount The number of currently pending requests
LastNeedsAcknowledgementEventTime The time of the most recent acknowledgement request
LastAcknowledgementEventTime Time of the most recent acknowledgement

Operators

AND Combines two expressions and matches if they are both true
OR Combines two expressions and matches if one or both is true
NOT Negates an expression or operator
= Determines whether two values are equal
<> Determines whether two values are not equal
< Determines whether one value is less than another value
> Determines whether one value is greater than another value
<= Determines whether one value is less than or equal to another value
>= Determines whether one value is greater than or equal to another value
IN Used to see if a property is in a set of values
LIKE Used to compare strings, usually with wildcards (* and % are both valid)
+ Add two values together
- Subtract one value from another
* Multiply two values together
/ Divide one value by another
% Mod one value by another

Variables

$USERNAME User name of the currently logged-in user, pre-quoted
$SERVERVERSION The version of this product running on the server, pre-quoted
$OTHERAND AND'ed-together expression of session filters of other filtered session groups not containing an $OTHER variable
$OTHEROR OR'ed-together expression of session filters of other filtered session groups not containing an $OTHER variable
$NOW The current time but rounded down to the hour; rounded down in order to prevent constant recalculation
$2DAYSAGO $NOW minus 2 days; any integer can be specified for days

Functions

LEN(expression) Return the length of a string
IIF(expression, trueResult, falseResult) Return one of two values depending on whether the expression is true or false
ISNULL(expression, resultIfNull) Return the value of the expression or another value if the expression returns null
TRIM(expression) Trim whitespace from the beginning and end of a string
SUBSTRING(expression, start, length) Get part of a string
CONVERT(expression, type) Explicitly convert between datatypes

Literals

Strings Quoted with single quote character ('); escape single quotes inside the string with two consecutive single quotes
Numbers All numbers can be used without quoting or any other special notation
Dates/Times Quoted with single quote character (') or number sign (#)

data.name: EditSessionGroupPanel.Message
data.value: Use session groups to dynamically organize your sessions. From the Administration page, administrators can also use session groups to restrict access to certain sessions and features.

data.name: EditSessionGroupPanel.SessionFilterSyntaxItems
data.value: CustomProperty1 LIKE 'ChangeMe' The value of CustomProperty1 (the default "Company" custom field) Session Attributes Name LIKE 'Untitled Session' The name of the session Session Attributes GuestLastBootTime < $3DAYSAGO Sessions that last booted up 3 days ago or earlier Session Attributes CustomPropertyN LIKE 'ChangeMe' The value of custom property N; N is 1-8 Session Attributes Notes = 'ChangeMe' A semicolon-delimited list of all notes added to the session Session Attributes UnacknowledgedEventCount > 0 Sessions that have an unacknowledged event count, like an unread chat message Session Attributes IsPublic = 1 A flag indicating whether the session is public Session Attributes Code = 'ChangeMe' The access code for the session, if defined Session Attributes SessionID = '1123g123-12a3-123d-123b-12312cd31da2' The unique ID of the session in GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) format Session Attributes GuestConnectedCount > 0 The number of guests connected to the session Participants HostConnectedCount > 0 The number of hosts connected to the session Participants Host = 'ChangeMe' The name of the host of the session Participants ConnectedParticipantNames LIKE 'ChangeMe' A comma-delimited list of all named participants connected to the session Participants GuestMachineName = 'ChangeMe' The name of the guest machine Machine Info GuestOperatingSystemName = 'Android' The name of the operating system of the guest machine Machine Info GuestClientVersion = '6.2.12876.6302' The version of client software on the guest machine, in N.N.N.N notation Machine Info GuestMachineDomain = 'ChangeMe' The domain or workgroup of the guest machine Machine Info GuestNetworkAddress = '0.0.0.0' The network address of the guest machine, usually in N.N.N.N IPv4 notation Machine Info GuestLoggedOnUserName = 'administrator' The name of the user logged onto the guest machine Machine Info GuestOperatingSystemVersion = '10.10' The version of the guest operating system, in N.N.N.N notation Machine Info GuestLoggedOnUserDomain = 'ChangeMe' The domain of the user logged onto the guest machine Machine Info GuestSystemMemoryTotalMegabytes = 1023 The total system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes Machine Info GuestProcessorName = 'Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU' The name of the processor on the guest machine Machine Info GuestProcessorVirtualCount = 2 The number of virtual processors on the guest machine Machine Info GuestSystemMemoryAvailableMegabytes = 82 The available system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes Machine Info GuestInfoUpdateTime > '01-01-2017' The time of the last information update for a remote machine. Date and Time GuestLastActivityTime = '1/1/0001 12:00:00 AM' The time of last activity on the guest machine Date and Time LastConnectedEventTime > '1/1/0001 12:00:00 AM' The time of the most recent connection for the session Date and Time LastDisconnectedEventTime > '1/1/0001 12:00:00 AM' The time of the most recent disconnection for the session Date and Time LastEventTime > '1/1/0001 12:00:00 AM' The time of the most recent event added to the session Date and Time LastHostConnectedEventTime > '1/1/0001 12:00:00 AM' The time of the most recent host connection for the session Date and Time LastGuestConnectedEventTime > '1/1/0001 12:00:00 AM' The time of the most recent guest connection for the session Date and Time

data.name: EditSessionGroupPanel.SubgroupExpressionsPlaceholder
data.value: Click + to add subgroups, or leave blank for none.

data.name: EditSessionGroupPanel.SubgroupExpressionsSyntaxItems
data.value: CustomPropertyN The value of custom property N; N is 1-8 Session Attributes CustomProperty1 The value of CustomProperty1 (the default "Company" custom field) Session Attributes Name The name of the session Session Attributes Notes A semicolon-delimited list of all notes added to the session Session Attributes Code The access code for the session, if defined Session Attributes IsPublic A flag indicating whether the session is public Session Attributes SessionID The unique ID of the session in GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) format Session Attributes UnacknowledgedEventCount Sessions that have an unacknowledged event count, like an unread chat message Session Attributes GuestConnectedCount The number of guests connected to the session Participants HostConnectedCount The number of hosts connected to the session Participants ConnectedParticipantNames A comma-delimited list of all named participants connected to the session Participants Host The name of the host of the session Participants GuestOperatingSystemName The name of the operating system of the guest machine Machine Info GuestLoggedOnUserName The name of the user logged onto the guest machine Machine Info GuestClientVersion The version of client software on the guest machine, in N.N.N.N notation Machine Info GuestNetworkAddress The network address of the guest machine, usually in N.N.N.N IPv4 notation Machine Info GuestOperatingSystemVersion The version of the guest operating system, in N.N.N.N notation Machine Info GuestMachineDomain The domain or workgroup of the guest machine Machine Info GuestMachineName The name of the guest machine Machine Info GuestProcessorName The name of the processor on the guest machine Machine Info GuestSystemMemoryTotalMegabytes The total system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes Machine Info GuestLoggedOnUserDomain The domain of the user logged onto the guest machine Machine Info GuestSystemMemoryAvailableMegabytes The available system memory on the guest machine, in megabytes Machine Info GuestProcessorVirtualCount The number of virtual processors on the guest machine Machine Info GuestLastActivityTime The time of last activity on the guest machine Date and Time GuestInfoUpdateTime The time of the last information update for a remote machine. Date and Time LastConnectedEventTime The time of the most recent connection for the session Date and Time LastDisconnectedEventTime The time of the most recent disconnection for the session Date and Time LastEventTime The time of the most recent event added to the session Date and Time LastHostConnectedEventTime The time of the most recent host connection for the session Date and Time LastGuestConnectedEventTime The time of the most recent guest connection for the session Date and Time

data.name: ExtensionsPanel.EditSettings.Message
data.value: The extension defines the following settings. Adjust these settings to affect behavior.

data.name: ExtensionsPanel.EmptyMessage
data.value:
No Extensions Installed

Extensions provide all sorts of functionality:

  • Additional features throughout the application
  • Language translations for the web and clients
  • Styling and functionality alterations
  • Downloadable utilities to use with the system
  • ...or create your own with the Extension Developer extension!

We recommend you try them out.

data.name: RevokeAccessPanel.AuthenticationSessionsText
data.value:
If you have reason to believe that user login credentials are being misused, all currently logged in users can be logged out.

Are you sure you want to log out all users (including yourself)? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: RevokeAccessPanel.DelegatedAccessTokensText
data.value:
Host passes expire on their own, but if you have reason to believe that a previously issued host pass is being misused before expiration, all host passes can be revoked.

Are you sure you want to revoke all existing host passes? This action cannot be undone.

data.name: RevokeAccessPanel.PrimaryAccessTokensText
data.value:
Force all technicians to immediately disconnect from all connected sessions at once. Your technicians will be unable to control remote machines until they reconnect to their sessions.

Are you sure you want to revoke all host session connections? This action cannot be undone.

data.value: Click the "Invite" button above to send an invitation to your guest(s).

data.name: SessionHelpPanel.InstructionsGuestPublicFormat
data.value: Instruct your guest to navigate to "{0:url}" and click on the session named "{1}".

data.name: SessionHelpPanel.InstructionsHostFormat
data.value: Join the session yourself by double-clicking on the session in the table or by selecting the session in the table then clicking the Join button in the toolbar.

data.name: SetupWizard.FinishMessage1
data.value: You have completed basic setup! You can make further changes to these and other settings on the Administration page.

data.name: SetupWizard.FinishMessage2
data.value: Select FINISH to apply your changes.

data.name: SetupWizard.LicenseMessage
data.value: Please enter your trial or purchased license. Need a license? Contact us for assistance.

data.name: SetupWizard.SecurityMessage
data.value: Please enter credentials for an administrative login account.

data.name: SetupWizard.WelcomeMessage
data.value: This setup wizard will configure basic settings for ScreenConnect.

data.name: StatusPanel.BrowserUrlCheckMessage
data.value:
ScreenConnect checked the URL you are currently using in your browser address bar. This URL should be universal and work the same for users on the server, on the local network, or over the internet.

Using a universal URL is required for sending an email invitation, or the user will be directed to a page non-existent to them. It is also good practice for general use considering the common need to access ScreenConnect from an off-site location.

Possible URLs are listed that may work for your installation. The success of these depend on your network configuration and whether the External Accessibility Check passed.

data.name: StatusPanel.ExternalAccessibilityCheckMessage
data.value:
ScreenConnect checked the external accessibility of your installation. For internet users to access your installation, network gateways such as routers and firewalls must forward specific traffic to the instance.

ScreenConnect attempts to automatically configure these gateways using Universal Plug and Play (UPnP) and the Internet Gateway Device (IGD) protocol. However, this often fails for a variety of reasons, requiring you to forward the traffic manually.

data.name: StatusPanel.RelayCheckMessage
data.value: ScreenConnect checked your Relay service to make sure it is started and working correctly. The Relay service provides communication for the Host and Guest Clients.

data.name: StatusPanel.SessionManagerCheckMessage
data.value: ScreenConnect checked your Session Manager service to make sure it is started and working correctly. The Session Manager service needs to work correctly for the Web Server and Relay services to get information on active sessions.

data.name: StatusPanel.VersionCheckMessage
data.value: ScreenConnect checked your version against the latest version to see if you are up to date. If you are not up to date, ScreenConnect checked to see whether your license permits you to upgrade.

data.name: StatusPanel.WebServerCheckMessage
data.value: ScreenConnect checked your Web Server service to make sure it is started and working correctly. The Web Server service provides the web page you are currently viewing, and it provides pages for your Hosts and Guests to connect.

data.name: StatusPanel.WindowsFirewallCheckMessage
data.value:
ScreenConnect checked the status of the Windows Firewall on the server machine. For anyone to access your installation, the Windows Firewall needs to be disabled or an exception needs to be allowed for ScreenConnect.

ScreenConnect attempts to add the exception automatically, but various issues can prevent this, requiring you to add an exception manually.

data.name: Timeline.ConnectionTitleFormat
ToolboxDialog.RunToolOption.RunToolElevated.Text
data.value: Run Tool with Elevation Prompt in Current User Session

data.name: ToolboxDialog.RunToolOption.RunToolInCurrentUserSession.Text
data.value: Run Tool in Current User Session

data.name: ToolboxDialog.RunToolOption.RunToolSilentElevated.Text
data.value: Run Tool in Non-Interactive System Session
